title: No, the nurses in the photo with Trump at Dayton Hospital weren't "paid actors."
text: Following the deadly mass shooting in El Paso, Texas, and Dayton, Ohio, in early August, President Donald Trump visited two hospitals to meet the victims of the attacks and thanked the first responders and hospital staff who treated them. However, after his visit to Miami Valley Hospital in Dayton on 7 August, Internet users began to share a false rumour that a viral image of Trump smiled with a group of nurses had been organized, and that nurses were in fact paid representatives. According to several Facebook articles, members of the media were not allowed to enter during the visit and women arrived at the hospital a few hours before Trump. While journalists were not allowed to enter the hospital during Tramp ' s visit, the rest of the prosecution is false. One of the articles shares a Twitter photo from a guy named Fred Galliley, who says: "I got a letter from a friend who knows a nurse at the hospital who told her that many of the women who were at the hospital wearing a nurse's uniform aren't working at the hospital. They showed up two hours before Trump arrived. That was organized. This is why journalists are not allowed." Another article now contains the eloquent picture of nurses smiling and holding Trump: "The media is not allowed. The nurses stated that women in this picture do not work in their hospital. "Why is he surrounded by the majority of the women who touch him? This is propaganda bullshit from a Russian agent who's been installed.
